page.title: 18Muchelney,tourism
page.content: Muchelney is a small village south of Langport_the name means 'The Great Island'.At one time the whole neighbourhood was marshland with only one or two areas above flood level. Many of the fields are only 25 feet above sea level and before the pumping stations were built it was quite usual for Muchelney to be cut off for long periods during the winter.Muchelney is widely advertised as a place for the West Country visitor to explore.Within walking distance of each other is a toll house restored in 1983 and now a cafe,the 15th century Priest's House owned by the National Trust,a 15th century church and the abbey. 5,904 people saw the abbey in 1984.The village no longer has its school or post office but it is well served by the milkman,baker,grocer,hardware van and the travelling library.
